original_title: Sri Lanka parliament nods for IMF Deal
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka parliament endorsed the IMF reform and associated conditions to be implemented through a vote.

President Ranil Wickremesinghe in his capacity as the Minister of Finance presented the detailed IMF agreement to the parliament on Tuesday (28) after a three-day debate the IMF program was endorsed by 120 votes in favor of against 25 votes.

“These kinds of debates have not been done in the parliament before. When an IMF deal is being done, it is not needed to be debated in the parliament, no it needs to be passed,” State Minister of Finance Ranjith SIyambalapitiya said.
“According to the IMF constitution, after the CBSL governor and the Minister of Finance sign it will be considered as a deal signed by the country,
“But this is a special treatment given to the parliament which holds the financial powers. This is a sign of democracy, and therefore we must look at this positively.”
The ruling coalition, nationalist Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) voted for the proposal (Colombo/ April 28/2023)
